tool.name: AssayGeneratorMetabo
tool.description: Assay library generation from DDA data (Metabolomics)
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } mkdir in_id && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_id/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_id if _]) } mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && echo ARGS && cat '$args_json' && echo HARD && cat '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} -in_id ${' '.join(["'in_id/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_id if _])} -out 'out/output.${out_type}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced' and $adv_opts_cond.ctd_out_FLAG && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: MzML input file(s) used for assay library generation

param.name: in_id
param.label: FeatureXML input file(s) containing identification information

param.name: out_type
param.label: File type of output out (Assay library output file)

param.name: fragment_annotation
param.label: Fragment annotation method

param.name: method
param.label: Spectrum with the highest precursor intensity or a consensus spectrum ist used for assay library construction (if no fragment annotation is used)

param.name: use_exact_mass
param.label: Use exact mass for fragment annotation

param.name: exclude_ms2_precursor
param.label: Excludes precursor in ms2 from transition list

param.name: precursor_mz_distance
param.label: Max m/z distance of the precursor entries of two spectra to be merged in [Da]

param.name: precursor_rt_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance window (left and right) for precursor selection [seconds]

param.name: use_known_unknowns
param.label: Use features without identification information

param.name: min_transitions
param.label: Minimal number of transitions

param.name: max_transitions
param.label: Maximal number of transitions

param.name: cosine_similarity_threshold
param.label: Threshold for cosine similarity of MS2 spectra from the same precursor used in consensus spectrum creation

param.name: transition_threshold
param.label: Further transitions need at least x% of the maximum intensity (default 5%)

param.name: out_workspace_directory
param.label: Output directory for SIRIUS workspace

param.name: use_deisotoper
param.label: Use Deisotoper (if no fragment annotation is used)

param.name: fragment_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance used to match isotopic peaks

param.name: fragment_unit
param.label: Unit of the fragment tolerance

param.name: min_charge
param.label: The minimum charge considered

param.name: max_charge
param.label: The maximum charge considered

param.name: min_isopeaks
param.label: The minimum number of isotopic peaks (at least 2) required for an isotopic cluste

param.name: max_isopeaks
param.label: The maximum number of isotopic peaks (at least 2) considered for an isotopic cluste

param.name: keep_only_deisotoped
param.label: Only monoisotopic peaks of fragments with isotopic pattern are retained

param.name: annotate_charge
param.label: Annotate the charge to the peaks

param.name: filter_by_num_masstraces
param.label: Features have to have at least x MassTraces
param.help: To use this parameter feature_only is neccessary

param.name: precursor_mz_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance window for precursor selection (Feature selection in regard to the precursor)

param.name: precursor_mz_tolerance_unit
param.label: Unit of the precursor_mz_tolerance

param.name: precursor_rt_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance window (left and right) for precursor selection [seconds]

param.name: isotope_pattern_iterations
param.label: Number of iterations that should be performed to extract the C13 isotope pattern
param.help: If no peak is found (C13 distance) the function will abort. Be careful with noisy data - since this can lead to wrong isotope patterns

param.name: feature_only
param.label: Uses the feature information from in_featureinfo to reduce the search space to MS2 associated with a feature

param.name: no_masstrace_info_isotope_pattern
param.label: Use this flag if the masstrace information from a feature should be discarded and the isotope_pattern_iterations should be used instead

param.name: profile
param.label: Specify the used analysis profile

param.name: candidates
param.label: The number of candidates in the SIRIUS output

param.name: database
param.label: search formulas in given database

param.name: noise
param.label: median intensity of noise peaks

param.name: ppm_max
param.label: allowed ppm for decomposing masses

param.name: isotope
param.label: how to handle isotope pattern data
param.help: Use 'score' to use them for ranking or 'filter' if you just want to remove candidates with bad isotope pattern. With 'both' you can use isotopes for filtering and scoring. Use 'omit' to ignore isotope pattern

param.name: elements
param.label: The allowed elements
param.help: Write CHNOPSCl to allow the elements C, H, N, O, P, S and Cl. Add numbers in brackets to restrict the maximal allowed occurrence of these elements: CHNOP[5]S[8]Cl[1]

param.name: compound_timeout
param.label: Time out in seconds per compound
param.help: To disable the timeout set the value to 0

param.name: tree_timeout
param.label: Time out in seconds per fragmentation tree computation

param.name: top_n_hits
param.label: The number of top hits for each compound written to the CSI:FingerID output

param.name: cores
param.label: The number of cores SIRIUS is allowed to use on the system

param.name: auto_charge
param.label: Use this option if the charge of your compounds is unknown and you do not want to assume [M+H]+ as default
param.help: With the auto charge option SIRIUS will not care about charges and allow arbitrary adducts for the precursor peak

param.name: ion_tree
param.label: Print molecular formulas and node labels with the ion formula instead of the neutral formula

param.name: no_recalibration
param.label: If this option is set, SIRIUS will not recalibrate the spectrum during the analysis

param.name: most_intense_ms2
param.label: SIRIUS uses the fragmentation spectrum with the most intense precursor peak (for each spectrum)

param.name: precursor_recalibration_window
param.label: Tolerance window for precursor selection (Annotation of precursor mz and intensity)

param.name: precursor_recalibration_window_unit
param.label: Unit of the precursor_mz_tolerance_annotation

param.name: min_fragment_mz
param.label: Minimal m/z of a fragment ion choosen as a transition

param.name: max_fragment_mz
param.label: Maximal m/z of a fragment ion choosen as a transition

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: ctd_out_FLAG
param.label: Output used ctd (ini) configuration file

tool.help:
Assay library generation from DDA data (Metabolomics)
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/UTILS_AssayGeneratorMetabo.html
